channel.title: openwrt on Shane Peelar's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in openwrt on Shane Peelar's Blog

item.title: Adventures in OpenWRT
item.description: Last time, I gave an overview of what is required to host your blog on your home router. Today, we’ll discuss the basics of OpenWRT and some minimal packages to install to get started. Introduction OpenWRT OpenWRT is a Linux-based OS that targets embedded devices. It’s based on buildroot and can be thought of as a buildroot tailored for network hardware. OpenWRT offers stable releases as well as development builds. Before getting started, check to make sure your hardware is supported before continuing.

item.title: Adventures in OpenWRT
item.description: I originally wrote a guide for using OpenWRT to host a blog on an ASUS AC-87u, but the instructions are a little out of date and need a bit of a refresh. This newer guide should hopefully be simpler. Overview To start, I’m hosting this blog on a Linksys WRT3200ACM in my own apartment on a nightly build of OpenWRT. I’m no longer using extroot as I was before, as my SSD unfortunately died on me.
